articles.description: It did not go to plan in England's Euro 2025 opener as they fell to defeat by France - so where did it all go wrong?
articles.title: England playing catch-up - what went wrong in France defeat?

articles.description: England face the first real test of their 'no-draws' approach, and coach Marcus Trescothick has hinted there may be room for manoeuvre.
articles.title: England vs India: Hosts hint at ditching 'no draws' approach

articles.description: McLaren's Lando Norris predicts that Sunday's British Grand Prix could be a "great race" with six cars in with a chance of victory.
articles.title: British Grand Prix: Lando Norris says 'great race' in prospect at Silverstone with six cars in with chance of winning

articles.description: Real Madrid's Trent Alexander-Arnold says his former Liverpool team-mate Diogo Jota "was there with me" after helping the Spanish club reach the semi-finals of the Club World Cup.
articles.title: Diogo Jota: Trent Alexander-Arnold tribute as Real Madrid win at Club World Cup - 'He was with me today'

articles.description: Clinical England produce a second-half masterclass to see off Argentina 35-12 in the first Test in La Plata.
articles.title: Argentina 12-35 England: George Ford shines in fine Test win

articles.description: Britain's Sonay Kartal is the shortest player left in the women's draw at Wimbledon but she makes up for it with power and speed around the court.
articles.title: Wimbledon 2025: Sonay Kartal on how power helps balance out her lack of height

articles.description: Kylian Mbappe opened his Club World Cup account in style with a stunning overhead kick in Real Madrid's thrilling 3-2 win over Borussia Dortmund – but the French star has his work cut out to displace one of the game's brightest young prospects from the starting line-up.
articles.title: Real Madrid: Gonzalo Garcia form and Kylian Mbappe stunner give Xabi Alonso selection headache

articles.description: Jasper Philipsen will wear the yellow jersey for the first time in his career as he wins stage one of the 2025 Tour de France.
articles.title: Tour de France 2025 results: Jasper Philipsen wins stage one

articles.description: Making an issue of the wet pitch wasn't a good moment for Lions head coach Andy Farrell, but Saturday's match might have been a good night for his son Owen.
articles.title: British and Irish Lions 2025: Talking points after win over the Waratahs
